name: TI-55-II
description:
The TI-55 was one of the first programmable calculator which keeps programs and data in memory, even when it was turned off.
112 pre-programmed functions, including statisticals.

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT(1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote>The calculator was sold with a very helpful manual (Calculator Decision-Making Sourcebook) giving step- by-step examples for the best techniques used for solving mathematical, statistical and scientific problems, as well as programming tips.</blockquote>
